intro: Coussapoa manuensis, commonly known as the Manu mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its humid, high-altitude habitat. Its leaves are usually broad and elliptical, with a waxy surface adapted to the moist environment. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
